data: Contract for the sale of a house and related structures

A lead sheet intact on the right side, damaged on the top, left, and bottom sides. The measurements below do not reflect the addition of a fragment to the left of the text as proposed in Souza 2022 in ZPE.

The top of the sheet is damaged and the first line of text is not well preserved, but does appear to be the first line of the document. The right margin is entirely preserved. The bottom of the sheet is damaged but the final preserved line of text does appear to be the last line of the document. The left margin is unknown, and it is an open question how much text is lost on the left side (see below in commentary). The text wraps and several words are continued fron one line onto the next, breaking roughly between syllables (Lines 4, 5).
Original discovery not recorded; first attested in the collection of Diego Ricotti Prina.
Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered in the province of Ragusa, with a particular focus on the sites of Kaukana, Kamarina, Castiglione and Monte Casasia
Association pour l’encouragement des études greques, « Bulletin épigraphique », Revue des études grecques, 1888, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/797735566
Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.
Giacomo Manganaro, «Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.», La Parola del Passato 44 (1989): 189–216
Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile. Tome II.
Laurent Dubois, Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile. Tome II. (Geneva: Droz, 2008)
More new readings of Hellenistic Sicilian real estate contracts involving women
Randall Souza, ‘More New Readings of Hellenistic Sicilian Real Estate Contracts Involving Women’, Zeitschrift Für Papyrologie Und Epigraphik 223 (2022): 71–81
Manganaro, 1989, Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.
Souza, 2022, More new readings of Hellenistic Sicilian real estate contracts involving women

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from Souza 2022 in ZPE.;
  • Line.2: Manganaro does not expand the phratry-tribe designations here or elsewhere in the text.
  • Line.4: [..]ν, M. and C.
  • Line.13: On the lamina, the letter in the final word that must be an omega or an alpha is rendered oddly with two vertical lines.
  • Line.14: δυ δ[.]κάτα, C.;
  • Line.15: M. read ...; C. read [....] δευ; I cannot detect the existence of letters on this line either by autopsy nor photography.
  • Line.16: [.]ΡΙΚΑΙΔΕΚΑΤ.. ? .., M.; τρί και δεκάτ, C. and D.

English translation

Randall Souza

When ??? was in office...--archos son of Hagelochos sixth (phratry)-second (tribe) bought a house, a portico...in the district of Herakles, and the courtyards from the inner room...and the well and the private mill and the doorways...for five talents from Dikaiagora the daughter of Antallos. [Guarantors:] Tenth (phratry)-first (tribe). Sixth (phratry)-second (tribe). Sixth (phratry)-second (tribe). Sixth (phratry)-second (tribe). Tenth (phratry)-second (tribe). Sixth (phratry)-second (tribe) or tenth (phratry)-first (tribe). Twelfth (phratry). Sixth (phratry)-second (tribe). Thirteenth (phratry).

Contract for the sale of a house and related structures Jonathan Prag Randall Souza John Fell OUP Research Fund ERC Advanced Grant no.885040 Randall Souza original data collection, research and file creation Jonathan Prag Project direction and corpus editing James Cummings original template creation James Chartrand site construction and encoding Valeria Vitale editing of geo data Michael Metcalfe museum data collection Simona Stoyanova standardisation of template and encoding I.Sicily ISic030057 698778 153131 71000208 340012 http://sicily.classics.ox.ac.uk/inscription/ISic030057 Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence Italy Sicily Ragusa Museo Archeologico Ibleo Ancient Greek

A lead sheet intact on the right side, damaged on the top, left, and bottom sides. The measurements below do not reflect the addition of a fragment to the left of the text as proposed in Souza 2022 in ZPE.

Lead lamina 6.8 8.5 0.1

The top of the sheet is damaged and the first line of text is not well preserved, but does appear to be the first line of the document. The right margin is entirely preserved. The bottom of the sheet is damaged but the final preserved line of text does appear to be the last line of the document. The left margin is unknown, and it is an open question how much text is lost on the left side (see below in commentary). The text wraps and several words are continued fron one line onto the next, breaking roughly between syllables (Lines 4, 5).

engraved

Main text has lunate sigma with crossbar (like a lunate epsilon), two-bar upsilon (longer right stroke), square epsilon.

List of witnesses has potentially several different hands that are difficult to differentiate: several different two-bar upsilons appear. There is a two-bar upsilon with the longer stroke on the right, as in the main text (lines 9, 12); a variant of this with the short stroke intersecting the long one almost at the top of the hasta (line 8); a three-bar upsilon with the intersection near the top of the hasta (line 13); and a two-bar upsilon with the longer stroke on the left (lines 10, 11). The epsilons have different slants and proportions. There is one omicron as in the main text (line 7), and one odd squared omicron (line 12).

 2 not recorded Kamarina Kamarina 36.8718784874, 14.4483234195 ca. 250-200 BCE Original discovery not recorded; first attested in the collection of Diego Ricotti Prina. Souza, 2014.03.24 (not on display) Acquired by the Museo Archeologico Ibleo in 1983.

ΙΧΛΙ αρχος Ἁγελόχου ἕκτα δευτέρα οἰκίαν παστάδα λαύραι τοῦ Ἡρακλέος καὶ τὰς αὐλὰς ἐκ τοῦ θαλάμμου ν καὶ τὸ φρῆν καὶ τὰν μύλαν ἴδιον καὶ τὰ θυρώμα ταΑ πέντε ταλάντων πὰρ Δικαιαγόρας τᾶς Ἀντάλ λου χήρας ΙϹ Διογένης Πρά δεκάτα πρώτα Ἡρακλείδας ἕκτα δευτέρα Διονούσιος Ω δευτέρα ος Εὐω δευτέρα δεκάτα δευτέρα ἕκτα δευτέρα ἢ δεκάτα πρώτα δεκάτα πράτα τρίτα καὶ δεκάτα
Text from Souza 2022 in ZPE. Manganaro does not expand the phratry-tribe designations here or elsewhere in the text. σὺν, M. and C. On the lamina, the letter in the final word that must be an omega or an alpha is rendered oddly with two vertical lines. δυω δεκάτα, C.; M. read ΔΕΥ; C. read ἕκτα δευτέρα; I cannot detect the existence of letters on this line either by autopsy nor photography. ΤΡΙΚΑΙΔΕΚΑΤ, M.; τρίτα και δεκάτα, C. and D.
